title: Sri Lanka’s Nuwan Indika Wins Bronze at World Para Athletics Championship
byline: International-level Sri Lankan para athlete Nuwan Indika secured a bronze medal yesterday (09) at the 12th World Para Athletics Championship 2025, currently being held at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi, India, from September 25 to October 5.

title: Bangladesh cruise to win over Pakistan in Women’s World Cup
byline: Bangladesh kicked off their Women’s Cricket World Cup campaign in style, cantering past Pakistan’s modest 129 with seven wickets and 18.5 overs to spare in Colombo on Thursday.

title: Vega to develop nation’s first AI-powered autonomous car
byline: Vega, the pioneering electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer behind Sri Lanka’s first supercar, is developing the nation’s first autonomous vehicle, leveraging advanced Artificial Intelligence and robotics.

title: Fitch warns debt risks loom after 2027 for SL despite fiscal gains
byline: Sri Lanka’s revenues jumped 27 percent in the first seven months of 2025, pushing the island nation into a primary surplus and helping foreign reserves recover to US$ 6.2 billion. However, Fitch Ratings warned

title: Rajeew Perera gets his well-earned reward
byline: Former Sri Lanka rugby player and current assistant coach of the National Sevens team Rajeew Perera has received the nod to coach St. Peter’s College following the exit of Sanath Martis whose illustrious stint with the Peterites ended at the end of the 2025 inter school season.

title: Promising local AI startups stifled by ‘prototype-level’ ecosystem, warn industry experts
byline: Sri Lanka has world-class tech talent capable of building AI-driven startups that can compete globally, but the country’s startup ecosystem remains “stuck at a prototype level,” hindered by limited venture capital,

title: Health Ministry concerned over misleading post on LGBTQ
byline: The Health Ministry has expressed concern over a misleading social media post that promoted the launch of an “LGBTQIA+ Sexual Wellbeing Clinic” at the National Hospital in Kandy, it is learnt.

title: Syphilis-like infection spreading among monkeys in Polonnaruwa - officials
byline: A recent research conducted by the Wildlife Department and the animal health authorities has revealed that a bacterial infection caused by sexual contact, similar to syphilis has been spreading among monkeys and macaques in several areas in Polonnaruwa.

title: One month-old baby found in bag outside retired health officer’s home
byline: A month-old baby girl abandoned by her mother was found in a bag yesterday in the Konwewa area, Ipalogama.

title: TikTok recommends porn to children, says report
byline: TikTok’s algorithm recommends pornography and highly sexualised content to children’s accounts, according to a new report by a human rights campaign group.

title: Bribery probe in progress against Kumara Jayakody; legal action if Commission decides
byline: Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) Ranga Dissanayake said yesterday that he would institute legal action against Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody over charges against him, depending on the Commission’s conclusion.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for five districts
byline: The Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Department of Meteorology has issued a warm weather advisory for Polonnaruwa, Batticaloa, Ampara, Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

title: Hold PC polls under PR system: SJB
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) today called for broad political reforms and thereby urged the government to hold the Provincial Council elections under the proportional representation system and to abolish the Executive Presidency.

title: Fire breaks out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery in Los Angeles
byline: A fire broke out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery, one of the largest on the U.S. west coast, California Governor Gavin Newsom’s press office said on Thursday, with a county official adding that the flames had been confined to one area.

title: Iranian Foreign Minister writes to Sri Lanka seeking solidarity on UN sanctions
byline: In the wake of the United Nations’ sweeping economic and military sanctions reimposed on Iran—a decade after they were lifted—Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has written to his Sri Lankan counterpart, Vijitha Herath, asking for Sri Lanka’s solidarity, according to Iranian Ambassador Alireza Delkosh.

title: Pradeshiya Sabha member acquitted as prosecution fails to prove abuse case
byline: A Kalutara Pradeshiya Sabha member was acquitted by the Kalutara High Court on charges of abducting and sexually abusing a 15-year-old boy, after the court determined that the prosecution had failed to prove the charges beyond reasonable doubt.

title: Water aerodrome opens at Beira Lake to resume flights between Colombo and Katunayake
byline: Flight services between Katunayake and Colombo were officially launched today using Beira Lake as a water aerodrome, under the patronage of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake.

title: Punishment not part of education, only suitable for animal training: Deputy Minister
byline: Punishment is not part of the learning process, describing it as suitable only for farm animals like sheep, horses and cattle, Health and Mass Media Deputy Minister Dr. Hansaka Wijeyamuni said.

title: Tamim Rahman to face High Court charges in LPL corruption case
byline: The Police Unit for the Prevention of Sports-Related Corruption today informed Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama that the Attorney General has decided to file indictments before the High Court against Tamim Rahman, the owner of the Dambulla Thunders team, in connection with an alleged match fixing incident during last year’s Lanka Premier League (LPL) cricket tournament.

title: Sabina Yousaf crowned Mrs. Sri Lanka World 2025
byline: Sabina Yousaf was crowned Mrs. Sri Lanka World 2025 at the grand finale held on Thursday (03).

title: India and China to resume direct flights after a five-year ban
byline: India and China will restart direct flights between the countries this month, India’s foreign ministry has said, in another step towards ties being gradually normalised.

title: ASPI surpasses 22,000 points for first time in history
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) crossed the 22,000 mark for the first time, driven by strong investor sentiment and heavy activity in the Banking and Diversified Financials sectors. Each sector contributed over Rs. 2 Bn to market turnover, underlining their pivotal role in today’s rally.

title: Australia retain Chappell-Hadlee Trophy after NZ T20 washout
byline: Australia retained the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy after rain washed out the second Twenty20 against New Zealand on Friday with just two overs of play possible in Mount Maunganui.

title: Severe lightning advisory issued for several places
byline: The Meteorolory Department today warned of thundershowers accompanied with severe lightning in the North-Central, Eastern and Uva Provinces and in the Vavuniya and Mullaittivu districts.

title: Maheepala Herath’s hotel on tank reservation demolished
byline: The hotel belonging to former North-Central Province Governor Maheepala Herath, situated on the Peramiyankulama tank reservation, was demolished on the orders of the Divisional Secretary in keeping with the ongoing demarcation of tank reservations in the Anuradhapura district.

title: Fire breaks out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery in Los Angeles
byline: A fire broke out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery, one of the largest on the U.S. west coast, California Governor Gavin Newsom’s press office said on Thursday, with a county official adding that the flames had been confined to one area.
